nameEntry.part: Records of The Salvation Army Boys' Home, Eden Park

biogHist.abstract: Records of The Salvation Army Boys' Home, Eden Park was an archival collection that until 2012 was held at the Salvation Army Heritage Centre, Archives and Museum in Nailsworth, South Australia. When the South Australian Heritage Centre was closed in 2012, all of the records relating to South Australian Salvation Army Homes were transferred to The Salvation Army Australian Southern Territory Territorial Headquarters in Blackburn, Victoria. This archival collection is now called "Records of the Salvation Army Boys' Home, Mount Barker".

cpfRelation.relationEntry: The Salvation Army Heritage Centre, Archives and Museum ( - 2012?)

descriptiveNote.p: The Records of The Salvation Army Boys' Home, Eden Park was held by The Salvation Army Heritage Centre, Archives and Museum. In 2012 the Heritage Centre closed and the records were transferred to the Salvation Army Australian Southern Territory Territorial Headquarters in Blackburn, Victoria.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Records of The Salvation Army Boys' Home, Mount Barker, The Salvation Army Australian Southern Territory Territorial Headquarters (1957? - 1980s)

descriptiveNote.p: The collection the Records of The Salvation Army Boys' Home, Eden Park became the collection the Records of The Salvation Army Boys' Home, Mount Barker.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Records of The Salvation Army Boys' Home, Eden Park', in Find & Connect - South Australia,

bibref.title: Records of The Salvation Army Boys' Home, Eden Park
